events.name: RDRC 2017 Pre-Conf Workshop: Next-generation web apps with dry-rb
events.description: Learn how to build a new generation of Ruby web apps with¬†dry-rb! This is a paid workshop.¬†Please register at https://ti.to/reddotruby/rdrc2017-workshop-dry-rb/ ¬†¬†Only 24 slots available!¬† This workshop is one of the fringe events for RedDotRubyConf 2017, which will be held on 22 & 23 June. Check out the conference¬†here! --- About the Workshop Found yourself tangled up in hard-to-maintain code? Been building app after app in the same way and never finding a way to make significant improvements? Vaunted object-oriented design principles proving too elusive or hard to apply? Thinking maybe it‚Äôs time to leave Ruby (_gasp!_) for something different? If you‚Äôve answered yes to any of these questions, this workshop is for you! Come along and learn how to build a next-generation Ruby web app with dry-rb: an app that is robust, cleanly architected, and just as easy to build now as it will be to maintain later. You‚Äôll discover how to: - Apply functional programming principles to Ruby applications- Model your application as a series of data transformations- Use dependency injection to take simple components and compose them to build larger pieces of functionality- Use strict typing to model your domain data- Validate user input with clarity and precision- Build an explicit persistence API with rom-rb- Use monads to safely manage complex behaviour and improve failure handling- Model complex behaviour as business transactions- Separate high-level application concerns into distinct layers- Write clearer, faster tests for all parts of an application Then you‚Äôll put these concepts to use in building your own application with dry-rb! At the end of the day, you‚Äôll have made some real steps towards levelling up as a software developer. You‚Äôll have explored a different paradigm in application design, practiced working with many new gems (15 at last count!), and hopefully found a new enthusiasm for Ruby and how you can wield it to write better, cleaner code. This workshop is intended for developers with some experience working with Ruby. You‚Äôll need to bring your own laptop, with a working installation of your Ruby development environment. --- About Your Coach  Tim Riley is a partner at Australian design and development agency Icelab, a co-founder and core developer of dry-rb, and a core developer of rom-rb. He‚Äôs been working exclusively with this stack for nearly 2 years, and is excited about advancing the state of web development in Ruby. See Tim's RedDotRubyConf 2016 talk.

events.name: Deep Learning for Self-Driving Cars and Healthcare
events.description: Event link: https://www.facebook.com/events/829973187162603 A talk by Marek Bardo≈Ñski, Senior Deep Learning Research Engineer, NVIDIA Switzerland. This is hosted by Ritchie Ng, Deep Learning Researcher, NExT Search Centre, NUS. We will be touching on cutting-edge applications of deep learning for self-driving cars and medical diagnostics. Also there will be a tutorial followed by networking with deep learning researchers from NUS and NVIDIA. Getting to The Hangar by NUS Enterprise: http://www.pathwaze.org/guides/hangar-nus-enterprise/

events.name: Meet with R3's Senior Developer Richard Green
events.description: Join our very special event featuring R3's very own Senior Developer visiting from London, Richard Green!¬† As reported last month, R3 has just¬†completed the first two of three tranches¬†of our Series A funding round, raising $107m to fund the development of¬†Corda, our distributed ledger platform designed from the ground up for the needs of commerce. It means all those people waiting for a technology that is fit for purpose now have certainty: Corda is here for the long-term and you can adopt it with confidence. Schedule 6:30pm - 7pm¬†Arrive, relax, and mingle 7pm - 7:45pm¬†Corda by Richard Green 1. Advances in Corda over the last few milestone releases along with what‚Äôs coming up. 2. Demo with Corda Demo Bench 3. Installing JARs on Corda Demo Bench 7:45pm - 8pm¬†We are inviting YOU to share your experience with Corda during this segment. Please PM me if you would like to share!
events.location: PayPal, 5 Temasek Blvd, #09-01, Suntec Tower Five , Multi-Purpose Auditorium, Singapore 038985

events.name: GTS Episode 5: iOS App Disassembly
events.description: Ever wonder what kind of information a hacker can extract out of your iOS application? Or how they can modify your IPA to unlock or add "features" and then redistribute them to normal users? As responsible iOS engineers, it is our duty to protect our users against such malicious exploits. Or can we? In this episode, we will explain and demonstrate common techniques and tools used to inspect and modify an IPA. Specifically, we will cover how to: decrypt a signed IPA, inspect decrypted binary, attach debugger, inject custom code, and repackage the modified binary. We will also talk about some scenarios we encountered during work where we utilized a couple of the described techniques to solve our problems. Speaker Andrew Eng Andrew is the iOS team lead in Labs, Sea with 4 years of experience in iOS development. He sometimes dismantles iOS apps and eats them for breakfast. Schedule 7:00 PM Registration, mingling and Pizza 7:30 PM The Talk 8:30 PM Q & A, and more mingling
events.location: Sea Office, 1 Fusionopolis Place, # 17-10, Galaxis Building, 138522, Singapore, Singapore

events.name: Code Clinic + TechLadies Study CS50 - 21 Jun
events.description:
Join us in this women-only Code Clinic and study group!! (Note: we are holding two events at one venue.) To register for this event, simply RSVP yourself as "Going" on this page.

## Code Clinic ##
Want to apply to the TechLadies Bootcamp #3? Need guidance on how to build your app? Come get help with your technical task!  Join us in this Code Clinic to have your questions answered. We have a group of coaches here to help you. 

## TechLadies Study ##
In this study group, we are taking the course, HarvardX: CS50 Introduction to Computer Science, on edX together. üë©üèª‚Äçüíª üí™

To join in this study group, please create an account on edX and enroll into the course at this link: https://courses.edx.org/courses/course-v1:HarvardX+CS50+X/info

Feel free to join us if you're taking another programming course that's not the CS50. :) 
------------------------------------------------------------------
Please note that this is not a workshop, but a pure Q&A hands-on session and study group. You need to be self-reliant as much as possible. 

Bring your fully charged, wifi-enabled laptop and we'll see you soon!

Note: Please buy something at the cafe as we're merely crashing that cafe. We don't want to be kicked out!

Psst! This event is for women only. :)
events.location: The Daily Roundup, 1 Keong Saik Road #01-02, Singapore 089109
